comment:
* Wrapper class holding a {@link Slice} and an {@link InlinePresentationSpec} for rendering UI
 * for an Inline Suggestion.

variables.name: mSlice
variables.comment:
* Represents the UI content and the action for the inline suggestion. * *

The Slice should be constructed using the Content builder provided in the androidx * autofill library e.g. {@code androidx.autofill.inline.v1.InlineSuggestionUi.Content.Builder} * and then converted to a Slice with * {@code androidx.autofill.inline.UiVersions.Content#getSlice()}.

variables.name: mInlinePresentationSpec
variables.comment: * Specifies the UI specification for the inline suggestion.

variables.name: mPinned
variables.comment:
* Indicates whether the UI should be pinned, hence non-scrollable and non-filterable, in the * host. However, it's eventually up to the host whether the UI is pinned or not. * *

Also a {@link Dataset} with a pinned inline presentation will not be replaced by the * new data set returned from authentication intent. See * {@link Dataset.Builder#setAuthentication(android.content.IntentSender)} for more information.

methods.name: public String[] getAutofillHints()
methods.comment:
* Returns the autofill hints set in the slice.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public static InlinePresentation createTooltipPresentation(@NonNull Slice slice, @NonNull InlinePresentationSpec spec)
methods.comment:
* Creates a presentation for the inline suggestion tooltip
     *
     * @param slice Represents the UI content and the action for the inline suggestion tooltip.
     * @param spec Specifies the UI specification for the inline suggestion tooltip.
     * @return An {@link InlinePresentation} for the inline suggestion tooltip

methods.name: public Slice getSlice()
methods.comment:
* Represents the UI content and the action for the inline suggestion. * *

The Slice should be constructed using the Content builder provided in the androidx * autofill library e.g. {@code androidx.autofill.inline.v1.InlineSuggestionUi.Content.Builder} * and then converted to a Slice with * {@code androidx.autofill.inline.UiVersions.Content#getSlice()}.

methods.name: public InlinePresentationSpec getInlinePresentationSpec()
methods.comment: * Specifies the UI specification for the inline suggestion.

methods.name: public boolean isPinned()
methods.comment:
* Indicates whether the UI should be pinned, hence non-scrollable and non-filterable, in the * host. However, it's eventually up to the host whether the UI is pinned or not. * *

Also a {@link Dataset} with a pinned inline presentation will not be replaced by the * new data set returned from authentication intent. See * {@link Dataset.Builder#setAuthentication(android.content.IntentSender)} for more information.

methods.name: public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)

methodNames: public static InlinePresentation createTooltipPresentation(@NonNull Slice slice, @NonNull InlinePresentationSpec spec)
public void writeToParcel(@NonNull Parcel dest, int flags)
